headline: Nike delays launch of women's brand in partnership with Kim Kardashian's Skims
summary: (Reuters) -Nike's launch of a new women's activewear brand in the U.S. through a partnership with Kim Kardashian-owned shapewear label Skims has been delayed, the Air Jordan maker's spokesperson told Reuters on Wednesday.  The partnership, which was announced in February, is part of new CEO Elliott Hill's plan to turn the struggling company around and broaden its product offerings to compete with brands such as Roger Federer-backed On and Deckers' Hoka.  With anticipation high among stakeholders and consumers, the two sides have delayed the launch as they work to get the product right, the Nike spokesperson said.

headline: Lululemon Is Cutting 150 Corporate Jobs
summary: A Lululemon spokesperson said following a "recent review," 150 corporate employees from its store support centers are losing their jobs.

headline: Lululemon Athletica cutting 150 corporate jobs as part of organizational changes
summary: VANCOUVER - Lululemon Athletica Inc. is cutting about 150 corporate jobs as part of changes to its organizational structure. The athletic clothing retailer says the affected employees are part...

headline: Why Lululemon Athletica (LULU) Bulls Shouldn’t Throw in the Towel Just Yet
summary: Over the first six and a half months of this year, Lululemon Athletica (LULU) has lost approximately $20.4 billion in market value, as the company faces a perfect storm: rising competition, inventory challenges, and a core market that appears to be reaching maturity. While these issues demand serious attention and action from management, Lululemon remains a standout in the apparel sector with margins well above average and returns on capital far exceeding its cost of capital.
